content.en: Discrete-event algorithms: Researchers are using algorithms to address various research questions in the field of discrete-event systems. These algorithms are being developed to verify diagnosability, test failure diagnosis, compute worst case detection delay, perform event counting, check detectability, achieve robust failure diagnosis, compute minimal event bases, diagnose systems in the presence of permanent loss of observations, test stochastic diagnosability, analyze fault manifestability, achieve minimal diagnosis and diagnosability, verify D-detectability, check delayed detectability, achieve decentralized state detection and fault diagnosis/prediction, and verify codiagnosability with dynamic observations. These algorithms are helping researchers understand and solve complex problems in the field.
content.da: Diskret-begivenhedsalgoritmer: Forskere bruger algoritmer til at tackle forskellige forskningsspørgsmål inden for diskret-begivenhedssystemer. Disse algoritmer udvikles for at verificere diagnosticerbarhed, teste fejldiagnose, beregne værst tænkelige detektionsforsinkelse, udføre begivenhedstælling, kontrollere detekterbarhed, opnå robust fejldiagnose, beregne minimale begivenhedsbaser, diagnosticere systemer i nærvær af permanent tab af observationer, teste stokastisk diagnosticerbarhed, analysere fejlfremtoningsevne, opnå minimal diagnose og diagnosticerbarhed, verificere D-detekterbarhed, kontrollere forsinket detekterbarhed, opnå decentraliseret tilstandsdetektion og fejldiagnose/forudsigelse, og verificere kodiagnoserbarhed med dynamiske observationer. Disse algoritmer hjælper forskere med at forstå og løse komplekse problemer inden for feltet.
